histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.AccessibilityMagnifierFollowsSts
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the magnifier follows the word being read by select-to-speak setting on the Accessibility page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.CaretBlinkInterval
histogram.summary: The text caret blink interval in ms chosen by the user. Logged on change from settings, from 12 possible values in a slider. The default value in settings is 100% which corresponds to 500 ms. 0 ms means "do not blink".

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.ColorCorrection.FilterAmount
histogram.summary: The color correction filter intensity chosen by the user. Logged on change from settings. The default value in settings is 100%.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.ColorCorrection.FilterType
histogram.summary: The color correction filter type chosen by the user. Logged on change from settings. The default value in settings is deuteranopia.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.ConnectBrailleDisplay
histogram.summary: Records when a user tries to connect or disconnect a braille display from the ChromeVox settings subpage within the Accessibility page, by clicking the "connect" / "disconnect" button.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.CursorColor.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records when a user picks any colored cursor (toggled on) vs the black cursor (toggled off) on the Accessibility page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.FullscreenMagnifierFocusFollowing
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kFullscreenMagnifierFocusFollowing setting on the Accessibility page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.FullscreenMagnifierMouseFollowingMode
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user changes the value of the kFullscreenMagnifierMouseFollowingMode setting on the Accessibility page. Records the value of the setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.MagnifierFollowsChromeVox
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user changes the value of the kMagnifierFollowsChromeVox setting on the Accessibility page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Accessibility.{SettingType}.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the setting on the Accessibility page for the feature: {SettingType}

variant.name: ColorCorrection
variant.summary: ColorCorrection. Note that color correction settings can also be enabled or disabled in quick settings.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Apps.DoNotDisturbOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kDoNotDisturbOnOff setting in the Notifications subpage of the Apps section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Bluetooth.BluetoothOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when users change the kBluetoothOnOff setting on the Bluetooth page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.BlurredWindowDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the settings window becomes blurred and when the user focuses it again.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.ChargingSoundsButtonEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when a user toggles the Charging sounds setting in the Audio subpage of the Device section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.Keyboard.AutoBrightnessEnabled.Changed
histogram.summary: Records each time a user toggles the keyboard auto-brightness setting via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.Keyboard.BrightnessSliderAdjusted
histogram.summary: Records each time a user changes the keyboard brightness using slider in keyboard settings. The value saved is the brightness percentage after adjustment. Fires when adjustment is completed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.KeyboardAutoRepeatEnabled
histogram.summary: Records value of keyboard auto-repeat Enabled setting at session startup.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.KeyboardAutoRepeat{Setting}
histogram.summary: Records value of keyboard auto-repeat {Setting} setting at session startup.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.KeyboardColorLinkClicks
histogram.summary: Records when a user clicks the "Keyboard Color" link within Keyboard Settings, that navigates to the Personalization Hub's RGB Keyboard Control section. Fires upon link clicks.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.KeyboardFunctionKeys
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kKeyboardFunctionKeys setting on the Device page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.LowBatterySoundButtonEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when a user toggles the Low battery sound setting in the Audio subpage of the Device section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Device.TouchpadSpeedValue
histogram.summary: Records when users change the Touchpad Speed on the Device page. The value saved is equal to the sensitivity value set on the slider, which ranges from 1 to 5.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times when users change the display settings via the ChromeOS Settings app. This histogram counts display settings that apply to both internal and external display, such as toggling mirror mode and unified mode.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.Internal.AutoBrightnessEnabled
histogram.summary: Records each time a user toggles the auto-brightness setting via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.Internal.BrightnessSliderAdjusted
histogram.summary: Records each time a user changes the screen brightness for an internal display. The value saved is the brightness percentage after adjustment. Fires when adjustment is completed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.Internal.UserInitiated.AmbientLightSensorDisabledCause
histogram.summary: Records the cause when the ambient light sensor was disabled by the user, whether explicitly via the settings app or implicitly through brightness adjustments. This histogram is triggered each time the ambient light sensor is disabled due to user actions.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.MirrorModeStatus
histogram.summary: Records each time a user toggles the display mirror mode setting via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.NewDisplayConnected
histogram.summary: Records when an internal/external display is connected for the first time. This is part of the metrics aiming to measure how well system provided default display settings work, by calculating the percentage of users who change the default settings after a display is connected for the first time.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.UnifiedModeStatus
histogram.summary: Records each time a user toggles the display unified mode setting via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}
histogram.summary: Records each time a user changes the display settings of an {DisplayType} display via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}.NightLightSchedule
histogram.summary: Records each time a user changes the display night light schedule setting of an {DisplayType} display via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}.NightLightStatus
histogram.summary: Records each time a user toggles the display night light status setting of an {DisplayType} display via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}.Orientation
histogram.summary: Records each time a user changes the display orientation of an {DisplayType} display via the ChromeOS Settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}.UserOverrideDisplayDefaultSettings
histogram.summary: Records when user overrides the {DisplayType} display settings (e.g. resolution, scaling) provided by default. Only record when the settings are changed within an hour of the {DisplayType} display being connected for the first time.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Display.{DisplayType}.UserOverrideDisplayDefaultSettingsTimeElapsed.{DisplaySettings}
ChromeOS.Settings.Inputs.ShortcutReminderDismissed
histogram.summary: Records when users dismiss the shortcut reminder banner in Chrome OS' Inputs OS settings page. The value saved indicates the keyboard shortcuts that were previously shown in the banner before the user dismissed the banner.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Keyboard.Modifiers.Hash
histogram.summary: Records the configured modifier remapping set for all modifiers as a hash. See //ash/system/input_device_settings/keyboard_modifier_metrics_recorder.cc for an explanation of the storage method and how to convert the hash to get modifier data.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Keyboard.Modifiers.{Modifier}RemappedTo.Changed
histogram.summary: Records the configured modifier remapping for the {Modifier} key when a user changes the setting in the Settings SWA.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Keyboard.Modifiers.{Modifier}RemappedTo.Started
histogram.summary: Records the configured modifier remapping for the {Modifier} key when a user session is started. Only emitted once per user per session. Default values are not recorded.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Keyboard.UserInitiated.AmbientLightSensorDisabledCause
histogram.summary: Records the cause when the keyboard ambient light sensor was disabled by the user, whether explicitly via the settings app or implicitly through keyboard brightness adjustments. This histogram is triggered each time the keyboard ambient light sensor is disabled due to user actions.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Interaction
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with different element in the Chrome OS's Languages OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.OfferToTranslateCheckbox
histogram.summary: Records when users check/uncheck "Offer to translate pages in this language" checkbox in OS Settings

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Languages.Toggle
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with a toggle in the Chrome OS's Languages OS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad and DocumentOnLoadCompleted events for the ChromeOS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the ChromeOS settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.MagicBoost.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with the MagicBoost toggle in the Chrome OS's Search and Assistant setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.MagicBoost.HelpMeReadEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with the Help Me Read toggle in the Chrome OS's Search and Assistant setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.MagicBoost.HelpMeWriteEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with the Help Me Write toggle in the Chrome OS's Search and Assistant setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.MagicBoost.Lobster
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with the Lobster toggle in the Chrome OS's Search and Assistant setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NotificationPage.PermissionOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the notification permission of any app in the Notifications subpage of the Apps section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumCharsOfQueries
histogram.summary: The number of characters for queries used to fetch results from the Settings Search Mojo API.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumClicksUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of clicks before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumNavigationsUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of navigations before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumSearchesUntilChange
histogram.summary: The number of searches before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumSearchResultsFetched
histogram.summary: The number of search results fetched each time a successful search request is made to the Settings Search Mojo API.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime2.{Time}
histogram.summary: Records the total number of unique settings changed by a user over a device's lifetime, regardless of whether they have changed a unique Setting or not. The recording takes place periodically.

variant.name: FirstWeek
variant.summary: Setting changed within the first week since the user has completed OOBE.

variant.name: SubsequentWeeks
variant.summary: Setting changed after the first week since the user has completed OOBE

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: Total Settings changed within the lifetime of the device per each user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.PerSession
histogram.summary: Records the number of unique settings changed by a user between opening and closing the settings app. Records on each window close.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.OverscrollHistoryNavigation.Enabled
histogram.summary: Logs whether the overscroll history navigation setting is enabled or disabled when it is toggled in ChromeOS settings. Compare to the histogram "Settings.OverscrollHistoryNavigation.Enabled" for other desktop platforms.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.PathVisited
histogram.summary: Paths visited within chrome://os-settings. For evaluating popularity and priorities for OS Settings UI.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.People.AddAccountCount
histogram.summary: Records when users click the Add Account button on the People page. The number of the account that would be added is saved, e.g. a sample of 2 means the user entered the add account dialog for a 2nd account.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Privacy.PeripheralDataAccessProtection
histogram.summary:
Records when the users clicks on the Peripheral Data Access toggle. A true value refers to the user enables peripheral data access protection (toggle is turned on).
Data may be missing from 2022-11-30 to 2023-06-09.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Privacy.VerifiedAccessEnabled
histogram.summary: Records the Enable Verified Access setting enabled/disabled value. This metric is logged with every UMA upload in ProvideCurrentSessionData()

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Privacy.VerifiedAccessOnOff
histogram.summary: Records when a user toggles the Enable Verified Access setting under the Security and Privacy section.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.RevenEnableHwDataUsage
histogram.summary: Records the result of whether users agree to send hardware data through the settings screen on unmanaged ChromeOS Flex devices. This metric is logged when "ChromeOS Flex hardware support and stability" setting is enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchLatency
histogram.summary: The time fetching search results from the Settings Search Mojo API. Recorded when getSearchHandler().search() completes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchRequests
histogram.summary: The number of search requests made to the Settings Search Mojo API. For search requests that succeeded with a response, the number of search requests that had results which were discarded, and the number of search requests that were shown to the user. Recorded when getSearchHandler().search() completes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchRequestsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of search requests made to the Settings Search Mojo API in one session of the settings app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultPersonalizationSelected
histogram.summary: External personalization search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSectionSelected
histogram.summary: Section search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSettingSelected
histogram.summary: Setting search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultSubpageSelected
histogram.summary: Subpage search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SearchResultTypeSelected
histogram.summary: Type of search results clicked by user in the OS settings search box.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the the setting id when the user changes a setting. Note that some of the values of the OsSetting enum aren't strictly settings (such as kKeyboardShortcuts, which is just a hyperlink). All of the recorded values appear in the settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SnapWindowSuggestions
histogram.summary: Records when a user changes the kSnapWindowSuggestions setting in the Multitasking section of the System Preferences page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.SunfishEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when users interact with the Sunfish toggle in the Chrome OS's Search and Assistant settings page.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.TimeUntilChange
histogram.summary: The time spent on the settings page before changing a setting.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.TimeUntilInteractive
histogram.summary: The time until the ChromeOS Settings WebUI is loaded, rendered, and interactive for users (as in they can change a setting). Automatically logged each time the app is opened (if not closed before interactive).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.UserActionOnSearchResultsShown
histogram.summary: The user action taken when search results exist and are displayed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Wifi.AddNetwork
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user adds a WiFi network that has not been added before.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.Wifi.Hidden
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Hidden" Wi-Fi network toggle is changed by the user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.WindowOpenDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when a Chrome OS settings window is opened and when it is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Settings.WindowTotalActiveDuration
histogram.summary: The total time the Settings window is active in a session. The timer starts once the user opens the page and stops once closed. If the user navigates to another window or if the device goes into lock mode, the timer will pause and it will resume once they navigate back to the Settings page. If user is on Settings page and the device goes into sleep mode with lock disabled, the timer continues and does not pause, which may lead to some outliers.
